subject: Real Estate
title: Egyptian Pharaohs and Crown Land
description: A micro-lesson that makes Egyptian Pharaohs and Crown Land usable.

hook.text: In ancient Egypt, the pharaoh owned every grain of sand. All land belonged to the crown.

buildup.text: Farmers worked royal fields and paid rent in crops. A good harvest meant survival; a bad one meant debt.

discovery.text: Temples received huge land grants and became the richest landlords after the pharaoh.

twist.text: After the Nile flooded each year, surveyors re-measured every plot â€” boundaries literally washed away.

climax.text: This annual re-survey invented geometry. The word means 'earth measurement' in Greek.

punchline.text: Geometry was invented to settle property lines.

quiz.question: Why did Egyptians re-survey land every year?
